core:datatype.help: The format of the stored samples in the dataset file. Its value must be a valid SigMF dataset format type string.

core:sample_rate.help: The sample rate of the signal in samples per second.

core:version.help: The version of the SigMF specification used to create the metadata file.

core:num_channels.help: Total number of interleaved channels in the dataset file.

core:sha512.help: The SHA512 hash of the dataset file associated with the SigMF file.

core:offset.help: The index number of the first sample in the dataset. This value defaults to zero. Typically used when a recording is split over multiple files.

core:description.help: A text description of the SigMF recording.

core:author.help: The author's name (and optionally e-mail address) of the form "Bruce Wayne wayne@example.com".

core:meta_doi.help: The registered DOI (ISO 26324) for a recording's metadata file.

core:data_doi.help: The registered DOI (ISO 26324) for a recording's dataset file.

core:recorder.help: The name of the software used to make this SigMF recording.

core:license.help: A URL for the license document under which the recording is offered; when possible, use the canonical document provided by the license author, or, failing that, a well-known one.

core:hw.help: Information about the hardware used (measurement setup, antennas, etc.)

core:dataset.help: The full filename of the dataset file this Metadata file describes.

core:trailing_bytes.help: The number of bytes to ignore at the end of a Non-Conforming Dataset file.

core:metadata_only.help: Indicates the Metadata file is intentionally distributed without the dataset.

core:geolocation.help: GeoJSON point object representing the location of the data collector

type.help: The only supported geolocation type is a GeoJSON `point`

coordinates.help: Longitude (deg), latitude (deg), and optional altitude (m) per RFC 5870

core:extensions.help: A list of extensions used by this recording.

optional.help: Whether or not this extension is required to parse this recording.

core:collection.help: The base filename of a `collection` with which this Recording is associated.

core:sample_start.help: Index of first sample of this chunk

core:global_index.help: If the sample source provides a global sample count, this is the global index that maps to `sample_start`.

core:frequency.help: The center frequency of the signal in Hz.

core:datetime.help: An ISO-8601 string indicating the timestamp of the sample index specified by sample_start. (e.g., 2017-02-01T15:05:03.000Z)

core:capture_tags.help: A list of short form human/machine-readable strings indicating features of this segment.

core:sample_start.help: The sample index at which this segment takes effect.

core:sample_count.help: The number of samples that this segment applies to.

core:generator.help: Human-readable name of the entity that created this annotation.

core:freq_lower_edge.help: The frequency (Hz) of the lower edge of the feature described by this annotation.

core:freq_upper_edge.help: The frequency (Hz) of the upper edge of the feature described by this annotation.
